In the SecondActivity, you need to call `findViewById` to find the DrawerLayout and set it as the drawer layout for the activity. Here is the updated code:

```java
public class Tutorial extends MainActivity {
    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.help);
        
        DrawerLayout mDrawer = (DrawerLayout) findViewById(R.id.drawer_layout);
        setDrawerLayout(mDrawer);
    }
}
```

In the MainActivity, you need to add a method `setDrawerLayout` to set the DrawerLayout for the activity. Here is the updated code:

```java
public class MainActivity extends ActionBarActivity {
    private DrawerLayout mDrawer;
    
    protected void setDrawerLayout(DrawerLayout drawer) {
        mDrawer = drawer;
    }
    
    // Rest of the code...
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: 
To display the Navigation Drawer in all activities, you need to extend the MainActivity and set the DrawerLayout for each activity. In the SecondActivity, you need to call `findViewById` to find the DrawerLayout and set it as the drawer layout for the activity. In the MainActivity, you need to add a method `setDrawerLayout` to set the DrawerLayout for the activity. This way, the Navigation Drawer will be displayed in all activities that extend the MainActivity.
